intro: Ophthalmophyllum cornutum, commonly known as the horned rockrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Ophthalmophyllum cornutum is adapted to arid conditions and can store water in its thick leaves and stems.
